Minneapolis.George R. Newell House (Minneapolis, Min: The George R. Newell House, also known as Chateau LaSalle, is a house in Minneapolis, Minnesota just south of downtown Minneapolis. It was originally built for Sumner T. McKnight, a businessman who had interests in lumber and real estate. McKnight sold it almost immediately to George R. Newell, one of the founders in 1870 of the grocery firm Stevens, Morse and Newell.
